de.iftm.dcm4che.router.receiver
Class DicomStorageSCPReceiver

java.lang.Object
  de.iftm.dcm4che.router.receiver.DicomReceiver
      de.iftm.dcm4che.router.receiver.DicomStorageSCPReceiver
All Implemented Interfaces:
de.iftm.dcm4che.services.StorageServiceEventListener, java.util.EventListener
public class DicomStorageSCPReceiver
extends DicomReceiver
implements de.iftm.dcm4che.services.StorageServiceEventListener

This class initializes a DICOM serverand receives incoming DICOM objects. To be able to adopt this fuctionality to upcoming versions of the dcm4che package most of the functionality is done by the sample program DcmRcv coming with dcm4che.

DcmRcv is fully configured by an object of Configuration. It creates an instance of Server and start the server. Inside the initPresContext method the instance itself is registerd as a DcmServiceBase of the server.

The Server implements a thread-pool and assigns every association with a separat thread. Each thread calls the handlers of the service elements defined in the registered DcmServiceBase classes.

As the DcmRcv overrides the doCStore method of the default DcmServiceBase implementation inside dcm4che all received objects are send to the doCStore methode of DcmRcv.

To avoid modifying DcmRcv to mutch, the functionality of doCStore methode is replaced by a call to DicomStorageSCPReceiver::doCStore(), which actually handels the processing.

protocol

private java.lang.String protocol
The transmission protocol to use.

Normally the 'dicom' protocol is used. The data are send unencrypted. If you would like to use the encrypted transmission, use the 'dicom-tls' protocol. If you use it, you have to define some other properties, named 'tls_xxx'.

dicom-tls: accept TLS connection (offer AES and DES encryption)

dicom-tls.aes : accept TLS connection (force AES or DES encryption)

dicom-tls.3des: accept TLS connection (force DES encryption)

dicom-tls.nodes : accept TLS connection (no encryption)

port

private java.lang.String port
Holds the port number of the server [default=104].

called_aets

private java.lang.String called_aets
Own AET (Application Entity Title). Default is "", that means association of any AET is accepted. The provided property value should be a comma or space separated list of individual AETs. Providing no value is equivalent to to a value "".

calling_aets

private java.lang.String calling_aets
AETs (Application Entity Titles) of the storage service users. Default is "", that means association of any AET is accepted. The provided property value should be a comma or space separated list of individual AETs. Providing no value is equivalent to to a value "".
